intro: Vangueria ruwenzoriensis, commonly known as the Ruwenzori vangueria, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Ruwenzori Mountains in eastern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
